Row.Text: Units receive a +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength bonus on their home continent. Additional Military policy slot
Luxury resources in his territory provide an Amenity to 2 extra cities. Military units receive +1 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for each different Luxury resource improved in Alethkar.

+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on a continent other that your [ICON_Capital] Capital's. When at war with a common foe, they and their allies share pillage rewards and share combat experience gains if within 5 tiles.
Accumulate 60% less war weariness than usual. Unit maintenance cost reduced by 2 Gold per turn, per unit. Capture defeated enemy units as Builders.

[ICON_TechBoosted] Eurekas and [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspirations provide 60% of civics and technologies instead of 50%. When completing a wonder receive a random [ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka and [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspiration from the era of the wonder, if available. Each Archaeological Museum holds 6 [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifacts instead of 3.
+4% [ICON_Culture] Culture and +4% [ICON_Science] Science per city-state you are the Suzerain of.
+4 Influence points per turn toward earning city-state [ICON_Envoy] Envoys.

All cities you found or conquer start with a Trading Post. If in [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route range of your [ICON_Capital] Capital, they also start with a road to it. Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes earn +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for passing through Trading Posts in your own cities.
One extra Wildcard policy slot in any government. Has 1 level of [ICON_VisLimited] Diplomatic Visibility greater than normal with every civilization that she's met. Receives extra spy capacity.
Combat victories provide [ICON_Culture] Culture and [ICON_Gold] Gold equal to 50% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit.

Units gain the ability to enter Ocean tiles after researching the Shipbuilding technology. [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes receive +3 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith, and +1 [ICON_Production] Production. [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes between multiple continents receive triple these numbers

Each city can build one more district than usual (exceeding the normal limit based on [ICON_Citizen] Population). Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to other civilizations provide +3 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Thaylenah. Other civilizations' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to Thaylenah provide +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Thaylenah.

Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to other civilizations provide +4 [ICON_Science] Gold for Shinovar. Other civilizations' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to Shinovar provide +2 [ICON_Food] Food for them and +2 [ICON_Science] Science for Shinovar. All cities start with an additional City Center building. (Starts with a Monument building in the Ancient era).
All mines and quarries give +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith. Holy Sites gain +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith if they are next to a Mountain.
When building Ancient and Classical wonders you may spend Builder charges to complete 15% of the original wonder cost. Builders receive an additional charge.

Combat victories provide [ICON_Culture] Culture equal to 50% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit. (on Standard Speed). Receives [ICON_Science] Science or [ICON_Culture] Culture from [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to civilizations that are more advanced than Russia. +1 per 3 technologies or civics ahead.

Additional Military policy slot. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking city-states. Combat victories provide [ICON_Science] Science equal to 50% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit. (on Standard Speed).
Earn all government legacy bonuses in half the usual time. +100% [ICON_Science] Science on Libraries.

The worship building for their Religion can be purchased by any player for just one-tenth of the usual [ICON_Faith] Faith cost. This worship building is enhanced to add 10% to the [ICON_Science] Science, [ICON_Faith] Faith, and [ICON_Culture] Culture output of Tukari cities.
Inquisitors can Remove Heresy one extra time. Combat and Religious units have a bonus of +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against players following other Religions.
All units have no combat penalties when injured. All units heal every turn, even after moving or combat.
All districts receive an additional standard adjacency bonus for being adjacent to another district.
All units receive +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking wounded units. When they eliminate a unit, they heal up to 30 hit points.
When you settle on a continent other than your home continent, receive a free melee unit. Additional Military policy slot. Accumulate 60% less war weariness than usual.
Alethkar unique melee unit. Strong unit but with high mantainance. [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General points for killing units.
Azir unique melee unit, replace the Man-At-Arms. [ICON_Culture] Culture is earned from kills on their [ICON_Capital] Capital's continent.
Veden unique melee unit. Strong unit but with high mantainance. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending.
Thaylen unique Medieval era naval unit that replaces the Frigate. 6 [ICON_Movement] Movement while in coastal waters.
Shin unique light cavalry unit that replaces the Horseman. Stronger than the horsenman an can build 1 Farm or a Stone Shrine.
Singer unique melee unit that replaces the Man-At-Arms. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one adjacent War Form unit. Doesn't require Iron.

Singer unique heavy cavalry unit that replaces the Knight. Stronger than a Knight and it doesn't require Iron. Adjacent enemy units receive -5 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength. Can move and see through Woods and Rainforest.
Tukari unique unit that replaces the Man-At-Arms. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when there is a religious unit within one hex.
Honorspren unique Medieval era naval unit that replaces the Frigate. +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on Ocean tiles.

A district unique to Alethkar which replaces the Encampment. +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for each adjacent district. This district does not require population, is cheaper to build, cannot be built adjacent to the city center, and is not a specialty district.
A district unique to Singers which replaces the Campus. Same as the campus but 1 extra bonus for adjacency to mountains.
Unique improvement. Gives +2 [ICON_FAITH] Faith and +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science. If next to a Encampment, gives additional +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +3 [ICON_Food] Food.

Shin unique improvement. Gives +2 [ICON_FAITH] Faith and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture. If next to a Holy Site, gives additional +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith. If next to a farm +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Food] Food.

Listeners unique improvement. Gives +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Production] Production. If next to a City Center, gives additional +2 [ICON_Production] Production. If next to a Industrial Zone, gives additional +3 [ICON_Production] Production.
Unique Azir building. Gives +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and 2 great writing slots.
Unique Taravangian building. Gives +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +4 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and 1 great point for Scientist.
Unique Thaylen building that replace the Bank. Gives +7 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +2 point for Great Merchant and +1 points for Great Admiral.
Unique Tukari building that replace the Temple. Gives +5 [ICON_Faith] Culture and +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science.
Unique Honorspren building that replace the Bank. Gives +7 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science, +2 point for Great Merchant and 1 Relic Slot.
